MergedSelections: [I travel on Firefly (the "budget" airline under Malaysian Airlines) for the convenience of flying out of Subang Airport. Recently, I opted for the 'taxi' booking to add on to my travel booking from the Firefly website. Let me tell you - NEVER opt for this. The airlines charged me MYR6 and it is really for no good reason and it was not explained clearly in the website. I was under the impression that "for my convenience" I could book a cab to get to the airport and this was the cab fare. It is not. It is merely to have the cab company call you to ask whether you need a cab!!! Which you can do for free on your own. So, in addition to the MYR6 you pay to the airlines, you will need to fork out the metered fare plus MYR10 (because you booked the cab as opposed to flagging it down at a cab stand). Do not get cheated by Firefly by opting for this "taxi service". ]I demanded a refund from Firefly and was promptly told I can complain by sending in an email to the airlines!!! How's that for service??!!
Unselected: I demanded a refund from Firefly and was promptly told I can complain by sending in an email to the airlines!!! How's that for service??!!
Selected: I travel on Firefly (the "budget" airline under Malaysian Airlines) for the convenience of flying out of Subang Airport. Recently, I opted for the 'taxi' booking to add on to my travel booking from the Firefly website. Let me tell you - NEVER opt for this. The airlines charged me MYR6 and it is really for no good reason and it was not explained clearly in the website. I was under the impression that "for my convenience" I could book a cab to get to the airport and this was the cab fare. It is not. It is merely to have the cab company call you to ask whether you need a cab!!! Which you can do for free on your own. So, in addition to the MYR6 you pay to the airlines, you will need to fork out the metered fare plus MYR10 (because you booked the cab as opposed to flagging it down at a cab stand). Do not get cheated by Firefly by opting for this "taxi service".

MergedSelections: Has anyone had as much trouble as I have had with Avro Flights. [I have recently had cause to get in touch with them to change my booking, I had to wait 35 mins for the call to be answered and at 10p per minute not a cheap call, Once I got through I was told the server was down and I would need to ring again the following following week as they don't open Sunday. I rang in the week and waited 28 minutes for my call to be answered, booking changed, received invoice via email but the details were incorrect, I wrote to them and got nothing back and had to ring again on Saturday, after another 22 minute wait my call was answered, I asked for the booking to be corrected, the operator assured me all was now correct - to date I have not yet received a corrected updated e-ticket which means only one thing I have to ring again as we fly to Greece in 12 days. MergedSelections: The airline pilots' union Balpa says it is lifting the threat of strike action at Virgin Atlantic which could have affected travellers' summer holidays. Balpa said it had secured a new offer from the airline, which it will present to its members in the coming weeks. Details of the fresh offer have not been announced. Last month, Virgin pilots voted overwhelmingly to go on strike for the first time in the airline's history in a dispute about pay. Balpa general secretary Jim McAuslan said: "Pilots have never wished to inconvenience the travelling public, especially those looking forward to summer holidays. We have therefore lifted the threat of strike action." Virgin boss Sir Richard Branson had warned that the threatened strike would leave an "indelible scar" on the airline.
Unselected: The airline pilots' union Balpa says it is lifting the threat of strike action at Virgin Atlantic which could have affected travellers' summer holidays. Balpa said it had secured a new offer from the airline, which it will present to its members in the coming weeks. Details of the fresh offer have not been announced. Last month, Virgin pilots voted overwhelmingly to go on strike for the first time in the airline's history in a dispute about pay. Balpa general secretary Jim McAuslan said: "Pilots have never wished to inconvenience the travelling public, especially those looking forward to summer holidays. We have therefore lifted the threat of strike action." Virgin boss Sir Richard Branson had warned that the threatened strike would leave an "indelible scar" on the airline.

MergedSelections: I see a lot of complaints and dissatisfaction by people who have used online reservations websites, and most of the problems people have had appear to be the purchasers' own fault. [The reality here, of course, is that there really is nothing unbusiness-like or underhanded, nor are there any "bait and switch" tactics in what these sites offer or what they charge as YOU authorize the total amount of charges which you agree to pay when you "submit." It isn't worth complaining if YOUdon't exercise reasonable care -- and READ THE FINE PRINT beforehand -- when using such sites. One thing to always be sure of is that you see a physical address for a legitmate place of business and someone whom you can contact should a problem arise. Without that, the website may well be a scam or dishonest.]
Unselected: I see a lot of complaints and dissatisfaction by people who have used online reservations websites, and most of the problems people have had appear to be the purchasers' own fault.
Selected: The reality here, of course, is that there really is nothing unbusiness-like or underhanded, nor are there any "bait and switch" tactics in what these sites offer or what they charge as YOU authorize the total amount of charges which you agree to pay when you "submit." It isn't worth complaining if YOUdon't exercise reasonable care -- and READ THE FINE PRINT beforehand -- when using such sites. One thing to always be sure of is that you see a physical address for a legitmate place of business and someone whom you can contact should a problem arise. Without that, the website may well be a scam or dishonest.

MergedSelections: [So i know this was a HUGE thread last year,and probably still ongoing,but I didnt want to hijack it 80 pages in.... ]What are the latest thoughts on refusing to switch seats,especially when there's retaliation? [My flight last night from JFK-FRA on Lufthansa was PACKED,and I guess a lot of people had their seats screwed up(so the pilot said as we were taxiing to the runway). I was on an aisle of a 4 seat section,and the guy next to me asked if I would switch with his wife,who was in the row ahead of us,in a middle seat. I declined,as I tend to be a somewhat anxious flyer(i dont show it,but I do need aisle access) and i reserved my seat 2 months ago. The guy was disgusted of course(the guy on the aisle seat next to the wife must also have refused) and proceeded to sit the entire flight with his legs in a V-position,leaving his left leg halfway under the seat in front of me.He also threw his blanket all over him so that it came into my seat(which i picked up and put over the side of his armrest-no fuss,just removed it from my lap) and stood in the aisle when i went to the restroom once and refused to let me back into my seat b/c "he needed to stand." I could have went to an FA,but it was a 6 hour flight and I didnt want any more issues. Plus I knew there was nowhere else to be moved. Thoughts?? Also,it was definitely a rude guy flight-the passenger in front of me reclined his seat ALL the way back(which is their right,I know,so i did the same)and complained to me that I was bumping the back of his seat everytime I moved around in my seat or got into my bag(which I did once or twice). I did tell him that if he pulled his seat forward he might not notice me as much,but he kept it where it was. Needless to say,the flight was just peachy. Lufthansa was fine,though,service was good despite the passengers. We had in seat entertainment,decent food,plenty of beverage service and free alcohol. Anyway,feedback is appreciated. ------]
Unselected: What are the latest thoughts on refusing to switch seats,especially when there's retaliation?

I declined,as I tend to be a somewhat anxious flyer(i dont show it,but I do need aisle access) and i reserved my seat 2 months ago. The guy was disgusted of course(the guy on the aisle seat next to the wife must also have refused) and proceeded to sit the entire flight with his legs in a V-position,leaving his left leg halfway under the seat in front of me.He also threw his blanket all over him so that it came into my seat(which i picked up and put over the side of his armrest-no fuss,just removed it from my lap) and stood in the aisle when i went to the restroom once and refused to let me back into my seat b/c "he needed to stand." I could have went to an FA,but it was a 6 hour flight and I didnt want any more issues. Plus I knew there was nowhere else to be moved. Thoughts?? Also,it was definitely a rude guy flight-the passenger in front of me reclined his seat ALL the way back(which is their right,I know,so i did the same)and complained to me that I was bumping the back of his seat everytime I moved around in my seat or got into my bag(which I did once or twice). I did tell him that if he pulled his seat forward he might not notice me as much,but he kept it where it was. Needless to say,the flight was just peachy. MergedSelections: I booked and paid for a flight on CheapoAir between 2 European cities. Later that day, I saw the carrier offering the same flight, class, limitations on their own website for literally more than 2/3 LESS than what I paid. I provided all the necessary documentation to CoA as instructed under their "Lowest fare guarantee'. They denied my claim because the carrier's website 'is not a US website'. They cite the lack of a US customer service number as a basis. (Note that an effort to use CoA's US phone number resulted in a 53 minute wait, followed by a disconnect, so I had to use online chat anyway.) I don't see the relevance, other than to contrive a way to not meet their advertised promises, However, it gets worse. CoA sent me a hotel coupon to use in conjunction with my (disputed) flight. I decided to use it to shave my loss. Found the hotel I wanted on the dates I needed. I provided all the information including full credit card data. Agreed to CoA terms, hit Confirm, and received a confirmation of - ANOTHER FLIGHT! Nothing about a hotel., No email confirm. Nothing. Now, forced to endure the one hour phone wait, I spoke to a representative who claimed that AmEx had rejected the charge. I called Amex and they denied that. Lie # 1. The CoA rep (still on the phone) told me she would book it directly, but after several minutes, told me the hotel had sold out, and would I like to book somewhere else? That is Lie # 2, because I promptly went to (very reliable) Hotels.com and successfully booked exactly what CoA had originally offered at the same (pre-coupon) price. I also confirmed the booking with the hotel itself. I've booked many air and hotel tickets with CoA, and never had a problem. However, I also never tried to do anything even slightly out of the ordinary, like use a coupon or rely on a guarantee, This is a trust business[. Buh-Bye, CheapoAir,]

MergedSelections: [Has anyone had any experience with Flighthub.com?] [Do not use www.Flighthub.com. I have been on the phone for 2.5 hours trying to reschedule a flight. Two agents that flat out lied. The first agent (Kay) had me on hold for over an hour then never returned. Total wait time 1 hour 15 minutes. Second agent (Lloyd) said he changed the reservation and updated the itinerary and would email it to me. Total wait time 45 minutes. He emailed the cancelled intinerary and did not save the new updated itinerary. Third agent (so frustrated I forgot her name). She states that there is no reservation and only 2 of the 5 new flights are in the notes. She states that they could not make the reservation and that I should call back on Monday for reservations. Total wait time 30 minutes. If I did not have a $1372.20 credit.....oh by the way, I had to pay $700 in cancellation fees to use the credit, I would never ever use them again.]

MergedSelections: Just when you think that after years of traveling virtually every domestic airline & a few international ~ you've suffered nearly all of the possible inconveniences ~ a new one comes along. Allegiant Flight [was 45 minutes late taking off from Memphis because they were "still loading baggage." We arrived in Las Vegas 1 hour past Arrival time. As we landed, the announcement was made to lower all window shades & place seat belts in seats, as the plane was scheduled to depart again quickly. Waited 45 minutes @ Baggage Claim. No bags. Passengers flooded Allegiant Office, where it was "determined" that the baggage was not in LAS, nor was it in MEM. & No there's not another flight from MEM today. Maybe tomorrow? By the time most had spent 20 minutes filling out Lost Luggage Forms, I (not one to give up easily) asked an Allegiant Associate if they were sure they had checked all possible cargo areas? @ This point, I'm thinking:: "Surely they didn't put a whole flight's luggage on a plane to ???" That would make no sense. It HAS to be HERE!!! She made a phone call:: "Has anyone checked the middle cargo compartment?" Held for a few minutes. Then "Yaaaaaaay!!!!" Duh . . . 1 more hour before we could retrieve it from the belt. So 2 hours 45 minutes of wasted gambling time. Bet I could have lost @ least $245 by now 😜 You would think they would at least hand out Free Drink Tickets, as we were all dry / parched / & way overdue for 1st cocktail. No. I didn't even hear "I'm sorry for your trouble / wait / delay / stress."]

Passengers flooded Allegiant Office, where it was "determined" that the baggage was not in LAS, nor was it in MEM. & No there's not another flight from MEM today. Maybe tomorrow? By the time most had spent 20 minutes filling out Lost Luggage Forms, I (not one to give up easily) asked an Allegiant Associate if they were sure they had checked all possible cargo areas? @ This point, I'm thinking:: "Surely they didn't put a whole flight's luggage on a plane to ???" That would make no sense. It HAS to be HERE!!! She made a phone call:: "Has anyone checked the middle cargo compartment?" Held for a few minutes. Then "Yaaaaaaay!!!!" Duh . . . 1 more hour before we could retrieve it from the belt. So 2 hours 45 minutes of wasted gambling time. Bet I could have lost @ least $245 by now 😜 You would think they would at least hand out Free Drink Tickets, as we were all dry / parched / & way overdue for 1st cocktail. No. I didn't even hear "I'm sorry for your trouble / wait / delay / stress."

MergedSelections: Given the chaos of the new carry-on rules and security issues with electronics, I'd like to remind everyone that there are ways to have things pick-up at your house and delivered at your destination - fully insured. And LOCKED. [I put this link up on the Orlando forum, but I guess it worth doing here as well. I pack and ship my stuff via FedEx or UPS all the time for vacation trips. It doesn't work for business trip and shipping anything like a laptop would be rather risky, more for what's on it than the laptop itself which can be insured - The contents can't! usxp.com/products_and_services/… There are other services available and many folks who want to have their own skis or golf clubs have been using them for sometime. Just google 'luggage delivery service'. You can also check sites like Travel&Liesure and Travel&Holiday for more resources. I like traveling 'luggage free', but it only works for non-perishables, and when you'll be arriving at a responsible destination, like a good hotel/resort or villa rental. Just a suggestion. It may destress some of the travel restrictions - except the laptop one!]
Unselected: Given the chaos of the new carry-on rules and security issues with electronics, I'd like to remind everyone that there are ways to have things pick-up at your house and delivered at your destination - fully insured. And LOCKED.

It doesn't work for business trip and shipping anything like a laptop would be rather risky, more for what's on it than the laptop itself which can be insured - The contents can't! usxp.com/products_and_services/… There are other services available and many folks who want to have their own skis or golf clubs have been using them for sometime. Just google 'luggage delivery service'. You can also check sites like Travel&Liesure and Travel&Holiday for more resources. I like traveling 'luggage free', but it only works for non-perishables, and when you'll be arriving at a responsible destination, like a good hotel/resort or villa rental. Just a suggestion. It may destress some of the travel restrictions - except the laptop one!

MergedSelections: [Just wondering if anyone has experienced anything like this. ]We were booked onto a TAP flight from Heathrow to Lisbon, Lisbon to Miami in July 2015 as a party of 9. [Two different groups applied for their Esta's. An email was received to say Authorised after the initial word on application said Pending. We could not book in online, it came up as check in at airport.] We arrived at Heathrow at 02:30 for a 6am flight. The passport machine would not let us check in.[ We were directed to different desks around the airport, the final one being the Special Assistance desk. There was already a family with a problem at the desk and there was no senior members of staff to help us. We were told there was a problem with our Esta. We promptly got the Esta number up on our mobile devices but the check in staff said it was too late to book 9 people in and closed the flight!!! We were told to go to the ticket desk and buy new tickets! There was no staff from TAP airlines to help us. The manager eventually came back from the gate and agreed to talk to us. After much discussion we were booked on United flights the following day. Our party of 9 were split up into 5 and 4. 4 going first via Newark, then 5 going 5 hours later via Houston. They would not discuss how we wanted the party split resulting in my daughter's friend flying with our other family members. We were due to arrive in Miami on Sat afternoon but got there Monday morning. We were at Heathrow for 32 hours with children. Tap would not help us with a hotel, meals, nothing! We have a case open with the CAA but at this point TAP are saying we did not have the correct documents. We did have them and produced them, there was no-one to help us at Heathrow. We had no different documents on the Sunday when we were allowed to fly with United.] Our argument is that there should have been someone there to help us. An immigration officer at the airport said our problem could have been sorted out by the airline in minutes. Has anyone got any advice on this? [TIA ---]
Unselected: We were booked onto a TAP flight from Heathrow to Lisbon, Lisbon to Miami in July 2015 as a party of 9.  We arrived at Heathrow at 02:30 for a 6am flight. The passport machine would not let us check in. Our argument is that there should have been someone there to help us. An immigration officer at the airport said our problem could have been sorted out by the airline in minutes. Has anyone got any advice on this?
Selected: Just wondering if anyone has experienced anything like this. Two different groups applied for their Esta's. An email was received to say Authorised after the initial word on application said Pending. We could not book in online, it came up as check in at airport. We were directed to different desks around the airport, the final one being the Special Assistance desk. There was already a family with a problem at the desk and there was no senior members of staff to help us. We were told there was a problem with our Esta. We promptly got the Esta number up on our mobile devices but the check in staff said it was too late to book 9 people in and closed the flight!!! We were told to go to the ticket desk and buy new tickets! There was no staff from TAP airlines to help us. The manager eventually came back from the gate and agreed to talk to us. After much discussion we were booked on United flights the following day. Our party of 9 were split up into 5 and 4. 4 going first via Newark, then 5 going 5 hours later via Houston. They would not discuss how we wanted the party split resulting in my daughter's friend flying with our other family members. We were due to arrive in Miami on Sat afternoon but got there Monday morning. We were at Heathrow for 32 hours with children. Tap would not help us with a hotel, meals, nothing! We have a case open with the CAA but at this point TAP are saying we did not have the correct documents. We did have them and produced them, there was no-one to help us at Heathrow. We had no different documents on the Sunday when we were allowed to fly with United.TIA ---

MergedSelections: [My partner and I recently flew back from Barcelona to Heathrow with BA. The flight was delayed by 2.5 hours, resulting in our getting into Heathrow after midnight, when all public transport other than taxis had ceased running. During the flight, we were told on two occasions by crew that if passengers were to take a taxi home, this would be refunded in full by the airline on presentation of a receipt. On arrival, we received a quote from a London black cab for £85-90 to North London. This would normally be an excessive expense for us, but as it was 12.30am we took the taxi in order to get home quickly (and in the understanding that reimbursement would be forthcoming). The final fare ended up being £97. However, on making a claim and presenting our taxi receipt, we were informed by BA's Customer Relations department that we would only be refunded £50 as the full amount was considered 'beyond reasonable' and it would be 'unfair to other customers' to make an exception. ]After querying this further - and stressing that passengers were explicitly told that they would be 'fully' refunded for any taxi journeys - we finally learnt [(via a response from the airline's Twitter account!)] that the maximum compensation given for transport is £50. I wondered if any others have experienced something similar? I think it's fair to say that we and the other passengers were misled by BA, who promised something only to fail to deliver, leaving us considerably out of pocket. [They also appear to be completely oblivious to the actual cost of a standard taxi from Heathrow to London! If anybody has any suggestions on alternative channels for proceeding with this, it would be much appreciated. I have already considered raising it with the CAA. ----]
Unselected: After querying this further - and stressing that passengers were explicitly told that they would be 'fully' refunded for any taxi journeys - we finally learnt  that the maximum compensation given for transport is £50. I wondered if any others have experienced something similar? I think it's fair to say that we and the other passengers were misled by BA, who promised something only to fail to deliver, leaving us considerably out of pocket.
Selected: My partner and I recently flew back from Barcelona to Heathrow with BA. The flight was delayed by 2.5 hours, resulting in our getting into Heathrow after midnight, when all public transport other than taxis had ceased running. During the flight, we were told on two occasions by crew that if passengers were to take a taxi home, this would be refunded in full by the airline on presentation of a receipt. On arrival, we received a quote from a London black cab for £85-90 to North London. This would normally be an excessive expense for us, but as it was 12.30am we took the taxi in order to get home quickly (and in the understanding that reimbursement would be forthcoming). The final fare ended up being £97. However, on making a claim and presenting our taxi receipt, we were informed by BA's Customer Relations department that we would only be refunded £50 as the full amount was considered 'beyond reasonable' and it would be 'unfair to other customers' to make an exception. (via a response from the airline's Twitter account!)They also appear to be completely oblivious to the actual cost of a standard taxi from Heathrow to London! If anybody has any suggestions on alternative channels for proceeding with this, it would be much appreciated. I have already considered raising it with the CAA. ----

MergedSelections: [EasyJet have announced they will close their base in Madrid this October, pulling all eight aircraft out and redeploying them elsewhere across Europe. Although only 20% of services will be lost within the next year, EasyJet are still selling tickets as normal through the winter season with no route or frequency cuts at all other than Manchester and schedules still show early morning departures and late night arrivals in Madrid, which shows that aircraft is based there. Why are they still selling these flights when us who take only little interest in the aviation industry know they won't happen but others less so will not? I'd say for the time being people DO NOT BOOK EASYJET FLIGHTS TO/FROM MADRID POST OCTOBER 2012 AS THERE'S A CHANCE IT MAY NOT FLY! Give it a couple of weeks or so unless anything happens before hand. Anybody remember when they closed East Midlands flights? They sold them and people were booking them when EasyJet knew they wouldn't fly at that time. Same seems to be happening here! Edited: 4:17 am, June 23, 2012]

MergedSelections: Booked a flight from Prague to Venice through Orbitz on Alitalia. [The flight time changed, but Orbitz didn't notify us, I just happened to check the Alitalia website the day before. That wasn't a big drama, but a bit annoying when you book through an agent for some service. The real problem started at the airport, we tried to check in but the airline had no record of our booking even though Orbitz had issued us paper tickets showing apparent valid ticket numbers. I tried to call Orbitz at the airport but by the time I finally got to speak to someone and have them understand that a) I was at the airport trying to check in b) No, i didn't want to cancel my booking and c) I am Australian, so my zip code has only 4 digits, we were forced to purchase new tickets at the airport to be able to board at a cost of around $250 before check-in close. Since the flight, I have tried to contact Alitalia about the issue, with no response whatsoever and Orbitz by email, who just say to call. When I call, I'm repeatedly put on hold (paying international call rates) and was told on the last call that "Orbitz will not refund the tickets as the airline re-accommodated us on a later flight." They do not read my emails or listen to what I have to say (ie. we only got on the later flight after we purchased new tickets), just keep repeating the line that the airline put on a later flight.] I don't want a refund for the original tickets, I want a refund for the more expensive tickets that we had to purchase at the airport! Any ideas of what else I can do?[ I'm sure we have some rights under the Montreal Convention but it's hard to make any claims when you get no response from the airline or incoherent, useless responses from the agent!]
Unselected: Booked a flight from Prague to Venice through Orbitz on Alitalia.  I don't want a refund for the original tickets, I want a refund for the more expensive tickets that we had to purchase at the airport! Any ideas of what else I can do?
Selected: The flight time changed, but Orbitz didn't notify us, I just happened to check the Alitalia website the day before. That wasn't a big drama, but a bit annoying when you book through an agent for some service. The real problem started at the airport, we tried to check in but the airline had no record of our booking even though Orbitz had issued us paper tickets showing apparent valid ticket numbers. I tried to call Orbitz at the airport but by the time I finally got to speak to someone and have them understand that a) I was at the airport trying to check in b) No, i didn't want to cancel my booking and c) I am Australian, so my zip code has only 4 digits, we were forced to purchase new tickets at the airport to be able to board at a cost of around $250 before check-in close. Since the flight, I have tried to contact Alitalia about the issue, with no response whatsoever and Orbitz by email, who just say to call. When I call, I'm repeatedly put on hold (paying international call rates) and was told on the last call that "Orbitz will not refund the tickets as the airline re-accommodated us on a later flight." They do not read my emails or listen to what I have to say (ie. we only got on the later flight after we purchased new tickets), just keep repeating the line that the airline put on a later flight. I'm sure we have some rights under the Montreal Convention but it's hard to make any claims when you get no response from the airline or incoherent, useless responses from the agent!

Once again, the staff were polite and professional - but this time I was prepared! My regular "explosive" solution was in my checked luggage, and in my hand luggage ]I was just carrying a 100ml bottle of solution that Specsavers [said shouldn't test positive - and they were right. For clarification, the solution that tested positive was Specsavers' Easyvision Allpurpose solution; the "safe" solution is the Easyvision Multipurpose. (apart from once in Bilbao, when they suspected it was something totally different - but that's another story ...),  in their hand luggage - they seem to be on the lookout for it (I was assured I was simply chosen at random, though I'm sure I spotted a look of glee in the security staff eyes when they saw the bottle going through the X-ray machine ...). For clarification, the solution that tested positive was Specsavers' Easyvision Allpurpose solution; the "safe" solution is the Easyvision Multipurpose. If anyone needs a 100ml bottle, they have a stock in Specsavers in Queen Street Cardiff ;-)

MergedSelections: This isn't a question, but more of a personal testimony of a good flight from a company with a bad reputation. [This was my first flight, so I did a lot of research. ]We flew from LBE to Myrtle Beach the first week of May with Spirit. This is a basic airline. The rules are clear.[ Our flight was on time, we arrived early, and had no problems. LBE is a small airport and very easy to navigate.] Leaving MYR, several women in line behind me had suitcases way over the 40lb posted limit, had several bags and purses, and were mad about having to pay. Pack smart, weigh your luggage, and buy the Big Front Seat if you can. It is well worth the extra money - especially if 2 people are going to fly together.
Unselected: This isn't a question, but more of a personal testimony of a good flight from a company with a bad reputation. We flew from LBE to Myrtle Beach the first week of May with Spirit. This is a basic airline. The rules are clear. Leaving MYR, several women in line behind me had suitcases way over the 40lb posted limit, had several bags and purses, and were mad about having to pay. Pack smart, weigh your luggage, and buy the Big Front Seat if you can. It is well worth the extra money - especially if 2 people are going to fly together.
Selected: This was my first flight, so I did a lot of research.  Our flight was on time, we arrived early, and had no problems. LBE is a small airport and very easy to navigate.

MergedSelections: Think twice if you are travelling to the Maldives with Thomson. [We were delayed 22hours last week and were late arriving at Male. We are both airline crew so were wise to the excuses they gave. They basically blamed snow, Spanish ATC and fog at Gatwick, all of which were lies! The airline were most unhelpful and had no reps at any point during the delay and lied to us about the reason for the heavy delay. Thomson couldn't even send a rep the next day to the Gatwick Hilton hotel with details of our departure time and on our return we should have been given a letter stating a technical problem for the delay not all the lies originally given. Despite asking for an address to write to for compensation via the rep in the Maldives she failed to give us a letter on why the delay happened, which we were entitled to and had to get a copy of this via a kind passenger. Because of the dishonesty and the fact they were spineless to confront their passengers we won't be using them again. This was by far the worst service I have received from any company and ruined a truly amazing holiday.]
Unselected: Think twice if you are travelling to the Maldives with Thomson.
Selected: We were delayed 22hours last week and were late arriving at Male. We are both airline crew so were wise to the excuses they gave. They basically blamed snow, Spanish ATC and fog at Gatwick, all of which were lies! The airline were most unhelpful and had no reps at any point during the delay and lied to us about the reason for the heavy delay. Thomson couldn't even send a rep the next day to the Gatwick Hilton hotel with details of our departure time and on our return we should have been given a letter stating a technical problem for the delay not all the lies originally given. Despite asking for an address to write to for compensation via the rep in the Maldives she failed to give us a letter on why the delay happened, which we were entitled to and had to get a copy of this via a kind passenger. Because of the dishonesty and the fact they were spineless to confront their passengers we won't be using them again. This was by far the worst service I have received from any company and ruined a truly amazing holiday.

MergedSelections: I've looked at the cabin bag allowance on the Emirates website and found the following: Economy Class passengers are permitted one (1) piece of carry-on baggage, either a handbag or laptop bag, subject to the following size and weight limitations: Handbag: 55 x 38 x 20cm (22 x 15 x 8 in.) I'm guessing that I am still allowed to bring a purse as well but just wanted to check if anyone has had any issues in the past. [Most airlines seem to mention that you can have a carry-on and a personal item but it's not mentioned here. My husband usually brings his scuba regulator as his personal item and we've never had an issue with other airlines. The checked baggage allowance is more than we need but we don't like checking our regulators in case they get they get jostled too much and don't work. MergedSelections: Wondering if anyone has any views on which JFK hotels have the most frequent/reliable airport shuttle service. [It's hard to find detailed information on hotel websites, and I can see from some tripadvisor reviews that some hotels only have hourly shuttle services (in which case it's probably worth getting a taxi for early morning flights, and I'll price that in when making my choice). Last time I had a 1 night stopover the hotel only operated a small minivan to get to JFK in the early morning (despite using a bigger vehicle the night before), and we had to wait over 10 minutes for the driver to try to squeeze all the passengers and luggage on, with some luggage/passengers ending up on other people's laps, and some left behind.]
Unselected: Wondering if anyone has any views on which JFK hotels have the most frequent/reliable airport shuttle service.
Selected: It's hard to find detailed information on hotel websites, and I can see from some tripadvisor reviews that some hotels only have hourly shuttle services (in which case it's probably worth getting a taxi for early morning flights, and I'll price that in when making my choice). Last time I had a 1 night stopover the hotel only operated a small minivan to get to JFK in the early morning (despite using a bigger vehicle the night before), and we had to wait over 10 minutes for the driver to try to squeeze all the passengers and luggage on, with some luggage/passengers ending up on other people's laps, and some left behind.

MergedSelections: I just called to clear the outstanding balance of 6 day trip to NY which cost my friend and I £400 EACH - bargain (or so we thought). When I called a few wks ago to pay of £590 I was informed that the airfare taxes had risen by £20pp. At the time of booking the agent who booked the holiday said it was possible that they would rise once before the o/b was paid off but not by much. I was a bit annoyed that I hadn't been called/emailed and informed of this, and that it was casually mentioned at the time of payment but I accepted it s I was told they need my "ok" before they could deduct the £590 off my card. I asked at least 3 times if the taxes would rise again and was told no repeatedly. All was fine and with the new £20pp tax fee ...my outstanding balance now stood at £64.90 and my friend's was £54.90. I called today (the last day to pay off the booking) to pay the final £119.80 and am told "Oh it's £150 you owe madam and if it's not paid today you will lose the holiday". I've had the worst week imaginable and completely lost my cool as I found it incredibly cheeky that they appeared to have plucked this sum out of the air as I had had my o/b confirmed to me repeatedly during the last phone call 3 weeks ago!! I disputed the o/b and went through the maths with the woman on the phone who couldn't understand what I was saying and was in a bloody call centre in India and who said that she'd escalate my complaint to a manager who'd call tomorrow...cue more ranting from me that today was the last day to pay the o/b and that a phone call tomorrow would be useless if she was saying that I'd lose the holiday if it wasn't paid off today. I asked to be transferred through to the sales team as she was in the customer services team and seemingly in a differennt country! After being put on hold for a while an English sounding guy came on the line, asking what the problem was..at this point I'm in tears as I'm so stressed out and he tells me "You won't lose the holiday as you're talking to me now. You called us, it's fine. Your tickets have been dispatched anyway". He says that the price of the holiday may have gone up and didn't I get any emails from the woman who booked it for me bk in October. I haven't heard from here since the day I bloody booked it!!!!!! I tell him how I was told that the taxes would not be rising again and how I'd budgeted down to the last penny for what I believed I owed. He gave me this agents direct line telling me she'd be in tomorrow 9:00-5:30pm and that she knew more about the booking and would be able to help me. I'm so angry at this shoddy service from Travelocity. You can't go adding money onto peoples outstanding balances without informing them beforehand!!! I lost my job recently so money is tight at the moment and to say I'm still shaking with anger is not an exaggeration! I was in bloody tears to the guy on the phone. I'm so stressed out at the moment. They can't do this again can they??? They'd have the call on tape where I was told in no terms would the taxes be rising again.. I wasn't even told by the lady in India where the additional £30 had come from!!!!!!!! Will be ringing the lady who booked the trip for me first thing tomorrow morning but would appreciate any advice if possible. Many thanks for reading my rant ....*and breathe*

MergedSelections: [Are travellers aware that in booking a package with Expedia that, in the case of Air France, luggage charges will be added to the fare at the check in desk, and you will be asked for immediate payment before being allowed to board? We recently returned from a trip to Florence, having booked a hotel and flights deal. On arriving at the desk, we were charged in excess of an extra £100 'baggage charges'. Of course, Expedia will no doubt point out that they do say (in quite small print) that 'the airline may make extra charges'. Such a pity that these nasty little surprises await us to add to the already stressful event that air travel has become, driven by the grubby and petty greed of formerly honourable companies. Read everything, no matter how small the print - NEVER trust a travel firm, 'tourist' has for some time meant 'sucker'. PM]
Selected: Are travellers aware that in booking a package with Expedia that, in the case of Air France, luggage charges will be added to the fare at the check in desk, and you will be asked for immediate payment before being allowed to board? We recently returned from a trip to Florence, having booked a hotel and flights deal. On arriving at the desk, we were charged in excess of an extra £100 'baggage charges'. Of course, Expedia will no doubt point out that they do say (in quite small print) that 'the airline may make extra charges'. Such a pity that these nasty little surprises await us to add to the already stressful event that air travel has become, driven by the grubby and petty greed of formerly honourable companies. Read everything, no matter how small the print - NEVER trust a travel firm, 'tourist' has for some time meant 'sucker'. PM

MergedSelections: [HI ]this has gotten to be a little pet peave of mine TSA and Customs are two seperate entities.[ when you enter USA . you go thru immigration to see if they will allow you entry. then you go thru customs where they look for contrabane. You do not go thru TSA. You only encounter TSA if you have an ownward domestic flight. when you leave USA or have a domestic flight then you go thru TSA security. ]Customs does not have access to the TSA keys to unlock bags. now I feel better that I got this off my chest.[ LOL]
Unselected: this has gotten to be a little pet peave of mine TSA and Customs are two seperate entities.Customs does not have access to the TSA keys to unlock bags. now I feel better that I got this off my chest.
Selected: HI  when you enter USA . you go thru immigration to see if they will allow you entry. then you go thru customs where they look for contrabane. You do not go thru TSA. You only encounter TSA if you have an ownward domestic flight. when you leave USA or have a domestic flight then you go thru TSA security.  LOL

MergedSelections: Just received an email from Trip Adviser offering me cheap flights to various destinations including Atlanta where I am flying to next month. Special cheap price with Last Minute, £440, not bad you think. Me to. Flights with KLM and Delta. Great. MergedSelections: I have just return from one of the first Jetstar Flight's from Melbourne to Hawaii. I realise it was a budget flight but it does not mean all components of the flight should be poor.[ 1) We left over 2 hours late both going to and departing Hawaii. No staff members were informing the travellers about any delays. 2) Food was extremely poor especially for the cost of $25 per person per flight. Going to Hawaii we only had one choice for each meal: Dinner : Small size Chicken and Rice, Salad and a small chocolate . Breakfast: A meat pie (Yes, that is right) for breakfast and a ice cream bar. Not my idea of a breakfast meal at 3am. 3) The flight crew were nearly invisible, mostly talking to each other for the flight, as our rubbish stayed infront of us for atleast 1-1.5 hours. 4) In flight entertainment - was not handed out until at least 2 hour into the flight.]
Unselected: I have just return from one of the first Jetstar Flight's from Melbourne to Hawaii. I realise it was a budget flight but it does not mean all components of the flight should be poor.
Selected: 1) We left over 2 hours late both going to and departing Hawaii. No staff members were informing the travellers about any delays. 2) Food was extremely poor especially for the cost of $25 per person per flight. Going to Hawaii we only had one choice for each meal: Dinner : Small size Chicken and Rice, Salad and a small chocolate . Breakfast: A meat pie (Yes, that is right) for breakfast and a ice cream bar. Not my idea of a breakfast meal at 3am. 3) The flight crew were nearly invisible, mostly talking to each other for the flight, as our rubbish stayed infront of us for atleast 1-1.5 hours. 4) In flight entertainment - was not handed out until at least 2 hour into the flight.

MergedSelections: What a diabolical service AA provide. [We had never used them before & got to LAX for a flight to Las Vegas only to find out it had been cancelled. Even though mobile phone number was provided when booking made, I received no phone call or SMS. We were not even trandferred or wait listed on the following flight (even though I hold a gold card (emerald) for a partner airline). Told us we were booked on a flight 6 hours later which would have meant we would have missed our pre-booked trips in Vegas. After inquiring about car hire & how long it would take to drive - we were informed that we'd get there before the one were not wait listed on would have even taken off !!! After a bit more complaining the manager came out & offered t omove us across to United Airlins. I bet that hurt :-) Return flight to Hawaii was not much better either, but we'll save that for another time. Spoke to Rolf Saxon at Las Vegas airport who wasflying on our flight to San Fran (on Virgin America) & even he said he would NOT fly with AA, & being an actor he is flying around alll the time !!!]

MergedSelections: [Our son lives in Atlanta and from time to time we get our grandchildren to come visit us in Florida. They have been flying in and out of Orlando on Air Tran. Now this is NOT a rant post against Air Tran but I am going to start flying them on Delta out of Melbourne. Reason being that the last two times we went to Orlando the service was so slooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooow that they missed the booked flight. Their luggage made it A ok but it took so long to get me a gate pass after they were checked in that we did not get to the gate in time. The problem seems to be two fold. First of all there are NOT enough agents to handle the load. Second is that you must stand in a line that is at the very end of the ticketing area and do not have a dedicated agent to deal with. So you must wait until another line is empty or another agent comes from the "back" to assist you. Maybe it is just Orlando and not Air Tran but I have never had any of those problems flying from Melbourne. Additionaly the security at Orlando is poorly organized and the TSA agents are in no hurry to get you to the airside on time. That is NOT the case in Melbourne as they are expediant and professional at all times.]

MergedSelections: I appreciate that there are still alot of stranded people out there and I hope you all get home soon. but here was our story. I thought it best to wait 'till we all got home so we can give hopefully a balanced perspective of events. We were due to fly home on 15th April, when it all first happened from Atlanta. We were about 250 miles from the airport, just waking up in our hotel room when we heard the news on CNN, and obviously devastated. It was more the "not knowing" than anything else. The website (BA) told us not to go to the airport, and it was about 2.5 hours to speak to someone on the phone. We had to go and return the rental car anyway at ATL so had some hours to calm down and think a bit, rather than turn up to check in totally unaware and panic. The news in the U.S on this was fairly low key at the time from what we saw, and we got more information by logging on to UK news websites, it really felt like doom and gloom from what the media were saying. On our arrival at check in, we handed in my pre printed boarding passes to the BA check in staff, and decided just to book ourselves on the next available flight out, which was 6 days later. Again feeling devastated by the wait and potential additional expense that wasn't budgeted for (or so we thought). The kids were upset, the wife too, however "keep calm" I said to myself, trying to hold it all together ,as there is nothing you can do. BA check in staff were truely exceptional, along with ATL dispatchers for the flight (BA226 ATL-LHR on 15th Apr '10). Although they could not doing anything about the flight, their service went beyond the call of duty in terms of help, advice, and being put up in a hotel nearby with all meals paid for. BA, the hotel staff, ATL staff, and the British Consulate in downtown all worked together for the benefit of the passengers. All of them worked 110% to help us, and it will never be forgotten. I was aware of the other horror stories from other airlines just "dumping" their passengers with little more than $7 per day to survive on. We remember a group of 4/5 parent helpers looking after 20 or so kids who were representing the UK in a robotic tournament in Atlanta flying on an American airline who had to start paying out of their own pockets. I hope you got back safely if you're reading this. We also rememberd at the consulate, another passenger "dumped" by another European airline, with no one to talk to, speak to, or given any advice until the Consulate stepped in. There are hundreds more I know, and we are lucky to be what I think are the fortunate few who flew on BA. I'm not one to hype up BA, as I had some reservations on flying with them, but after this experience, and if I ever decide to fly again then there will only be 1 airline to choose from. I hope everyone can receive some form of recompense. Up to then my faith in British society had been strained to say the least, but this experience is something I'll never forget, that yes there are people out there who care and want to make a difference. I hope everyone out there still gets home safely and quickly.

MergedSelections: Just wanted to relieve some of the anxiety for those of you who have booked flights with Globespan and heard the horror stories. I was very apprehensive and expecting some delays, but everything was fine. We flew out of the Hamilton, Ontario, terminal and it was great! So compact, no walking, just park the car, walk in, check in, and on the plane. Wonderful compared to Pearson. Arrived in Dublin, Ireland on time. Flight over was in an older aircraft purchased from an Icelandic airline. We bought economy no frills and it was pretty tight for leg room. If you have long legs, spring for the premier. Other than that, it was just fine - plane left and arrived on time. On the flight home, we got a "free" meal and non alcoholic drinks, even though it said on the website you needed to preorder the meals. The people that preordered got a different meal (beef or pasta dish). We got a type of chili with vegetables and a bun with a dessert. Can't say every flight will go as smoothly, but I hope this will help with some of the apprehension involved with this airline.
Unselected: Just wanted to relieve some of the anxiety for those of you who have booked flights with Globespan and heard the horror stories. I was very apprehensive and expecting some delays, but everything was fine. We flew out of the Hamilton, Ontario, terminal and it was great! So compact, no walking, just park the car, walk in, check in, and on the plane. Wonderful compared to Pearson. Arrived in Dublin, Ireland on time. Flight over was in an older aircraft purchased from an Icelandic airline. We bought economy no frills and it was pretty tight for leg room. If you have long legs, spring for the premier. Other than that, it was just fine - plane left and arrived on time. On the flight home, we got a "free" meal and non alcoholic drinks, even though it said on the website you needed to preorder the meals. The people that preordered got a different meal (beef or pasta dish). We got a type of chili with vegetables and a bun with a dessert. Can't say every flight will go as smoothly, but I hope this will help with some of the apprehension involved with this airline.

MergedSelections: The topic of airfare price drops has been done to death [I guess but I'll give it another whack.] Is Air Canada the worst offender?[ I am not an experienced air traveller but ]I was very surprised to find the airfare for the same flights I booked in early February from Australia to Vancouver return (Sep/Oct travel) have dropped by 25% six weeks later! [I booked the cheapest fare (economy tango) for my family on our first international trip and I chose Air Canada because it is a direct flight and we have limited time during school holidays. The airlines seem to know when it is holiday time and bump up the prices. I have to say 25% is a significant price drop for the same class seats on the same flights. I am disappointed at losing $2000 and it is an unfortunate lesson. If I could afford the higher fares I gather the tickets would be refundable and I would not lose out, except for the nasty cancellation fee. My tickets are not refundable and I am informed there is no option to rebook at the new lower fare. I wouldn't mind so much if the price drop wasn't so large. If this is a normal occurrence it seems booking with Air Canada is like spending money on a lottery ticket.]
Unselected: The topic of airfare price drops has been done to death  Is Air Canada the worst offender?I was very surprised to find the airfare for the same flights I booked in early February from Australia to Vancouver return (Sep/Oct travel) have dropped by 25% six weeks later!
Selected: I guess but I'll give it another whack. I am not an experienced air traveller but I booked the cheapest fare (economy tango) for my family on our first international trip and I chose Air Canada because it is a direct flight and we have limited time during school holidays. The airlines seem to know when it is holiday time and bump up the prices. I have to say 25% is a significant price drop for the same class seats on the same flights. I am disappointed at losing $2000 and it is an unfortunate lesson. If I could afford the higher fares I gather the tickets would be refundable and I would not lose out, except for the nasty cancellation fee. My tickets are not refundable and I am informed there is no option to rebook at the new lower fare. I wouldn't mind so much if the price drop wasn't so large. If this is a normal occurrence it seems booking with Air Canada is like spending money on a lottery ticket.

MergedSelections: Just want to give others a heads up that Cheap Caribbean/Apple Group is a company with horrible business practices as well as customer support. [Be very aware that when you click on accepting the terms of use this company will not compensate you for any errors they have made. Our experience is a result of this company not disclosing on their website they charge in US currency. However, looking through various sites even US based clients have had several issues regarding this company not providing compensation for legitimate complaints. I have sent the following email to the founder of Apple Leisure and the CEO and they refuse to respond. You will also notice the contact info for this company is very vague on their website. In short, we have booked vacations through many on-line companies that are ethical. THis one is not so do not expect any client support from them..... I am writing today to tell you how disappointed I am in your misleading business practices and disgusted I am with your customer support (a common thread in many reviews for your company). I shop on-line a lot and book trips through on-line travel sites so I am knowledgeable on how things work at check-out. I am from Canada and shop in the US, UK and, of course, Canada. We used Cheap Caribbean last year to book a trip and we were charged Canadian funds (funds were at par) and because of this we assumed your company charges us in our currency. There is NOTHING on the website or at checkout to indicate otherwise. For example, even when we book with Hotwire US we are quoted at checkout USD meaning the final price states clearly USD. Cheap Caribbean does not specify anywhere on the website or on our ticket voucher you charge in USD. There is nothing in your contract either to indicate you charge in USD. We were pretty shocked when we were billed $450+ more than we were invoiced for on our credit card. When I called customer care indicating I expect a refund the differance I was informed by a robotic like human ...we are a US company we charge in USD. I could not get Bobby to understand the issue is not that you charge in USD, you don't tell your customers you charge USD. A call to the supervisor was a waste of time. He could care less. The LAST think a customer wants to here is "we are not doing anything for you". So, as a result of this I have filed a complaint with the BBB and had several conversations with my friends and coworkers telling them how misleading this company is and all I spoke to are shocked you do not indicate what currency you charge in. Your refusal to pay back what you should not have charged in the first place will cost you a lot of future business. Your lack of action speaks volumes about your business practices (shady) and you lack of interest in customer satisfaction. Also, you may want to have a supervisor train your service reps. When asked ``How are you`the response of `I am okay`is not professional at all. In addition, perhaps educate your staff that a .com company does not indicate you are US based. I work for a Canadian based company with a .com site. Then again, we are ethical and clearly indicate currency charged on our invoices.]

MergedSelections: On a flight from Sydney to Nepal on China Southern in December 2015 I had my bags opened in Guangzhou. I was told they identified lithium batteries. The bags finally arrived 2 days late and 4 Kgs lighter with no evidence who opened them, what was removed or why. [The items missing included (I didn't have a comprehensive list of the contents): * a cordless drill (the whole thing including the case was taken not just the battery) * a bicycle light (again the whole set was removed not just the battery) * a cartridge of silicone sealant * a cartridge of adhesive * a bottle of medicines The airline has refused to take responsibility saying the items were removed by security personnel.] Do I have any avenue to appeal or take this further? [Thanks.]

MergedSelections: [Hi all,] I booked a so-called 'Around the world' ticket with Travel-Nation, [a UK based travel agency. They deal in multi-stop itineraries, on which special rules seem to apply. When they asked us for our passenger information we provided them with the correct information regarding first and last names. However,] when they sent our itinerary, my first name was misspelled. [I usually write my name as 'Luuk', while my passport says 'Lucas'. I remember signing emails with Luuk, yet I also know that I gave the correct passport names when asked. When I was at Heathrow airport I first encountered that the name on my ticket didnt match my passport. At that point it wasn't to big a deal, but I got to fly anyway. I tried to change my name at the AIR New Zealand service desk, but they couldnt do it and said that the travel agent had to do it. I'm currently in Australia after stopping over in Hong Kong. I could make all flights with the wrong name, even if that sometimes led to skewed faces. ]I've contacted the travel agent (Travel Nation) and asked them if they could change my name, [since I provided them with the correct names. ]They told me it couldnt be done, since I already started travelling. Instead the added a note, stating that my first name was misspelled. [In the accompanying email (in which my first name was misspelled again as Luuc!!!!!) they stated that 'this is not a guarantee for the USA'. So now I'm getting a bit freaked. I'm sure that I will be able to fly to all my other destinations, but If I cant fly to the US, that would be awfull. ]Is there nothing that can be done?
Unselected: I booked a so-called 'Around the world' ticket with Travel-Nation,  when they sent our itinerary, my first name was misspelled. I've contacted the travel agent (Travel Nation) and asked them if they could change my name, They told me it couldnt be done, since I already started travelling. Instead the added a note, stating that my first name was misspelled. Is there nothing that can be done?
Selected: Hi all,a UK based travel agency. They deal in multi-stop itineraries, on which special rules seem to apply. When they asked us for our passenger information we provided them with the correct information regarding first and last names. However,I usually write my name as 'Luuk', while my passport says 'Lucas'. I remember signing emails with Luuk, yet I also know that I gave the correct passport names when asked. When I was at Heathrow airport I first encountered that the name on my ticket didnt match my passport. At that point it wasn't to big a deal, but I got to fly anyway. I tried to change my name at the AIR New Zealand service desk, but they couldnt do it and said that the travel agent had to do it. I'm currently in Australia after stopping over in Hong Kong. I could make all flights with the wrong name, even if that sometimes led to skewed faces. since I provided them with the correct names. In the accompanying email (in which my first name was misspelled again as Luuc!!!!!) they stated that 'this is not a guarantee for the USA'. So now I'm getting a bit freaked. I'm sure that I will be able to fly to all my other destinations, but If I cant fly to the US, that would be awfull.

MergedSelections: When attempting to check in yesterday for an Aeromexico return flight from Mexico City to the U.S. I was the told the flight was oversold and there were no seats for me and my wife, despite having booked a round trip ticket on Aeromexico’s website months in advance, having a confirmation number and seats assigned. I was told overbooking by 10% was “legal” due to it being the "high travel season." [This seems to be common practice by Aeromexico, whatever the whatever the season, as I and others have experienced this on numerous occasions with this airline (a friend booked on the next flight had the same experience), convincing me to avoid Aeromexico at all costs. After speaking with an extremely unhelpful and rude supervisor, and explaining our situation, she said she would investigate further and disappeared, only to return 45 minutes later to again repeat there were no seats for us. She promised to place us first on a wait list for the flight we had booked. When we appeared at the departure gate we noticed our names were numbers 18 and 22 on the electronic display of wait listed passengers. Aeromexico and its staff do not understand customer service. Avoid this airline at all costs, particularly if your arrival time is of the essence, either for a connecting flight or an important appointment.]

I was told overbooking by 10% was “legal” due to it being the "high travel season."
Selected: This seems to be common practice by Aeromexico, whatever the whatever the season, as I and others have experienced this on numerous occasions with this airline (a friend booked on the next flight had the same experience), convincing me to avoid Aeromexico at all costs. After speaking with an extremely unhelpful and rude supervisor, and explaining our situation, she said she would investigate further and disappeared, only to return 45 minutes later to again repeat there were no seats for us. She promised to place us first on a wait list for the flight we had booked. When we appeared at the departure gate we noticed our names were numbers 18 and 22 on the electronic display of wait listed passengers. Aeromexico and its staff do not understand customer service. MergedSelections: [The bottom line on Delta Coach:] DON'T FLY DELTA COACH UNLESS IT IS A NEW 767. [Delta's other planes are configured with so little seat room, leg room, etc. (i.e., pitch) that they are like CROWDED CATTLE CARS. The airline should be ashamed to even put people on those planes, but clearly Delta does not care one iota about its passengers' comfort, even for long flights. I made the mistake on a recent HNL to LAX flight of flying Delta coach on a 757; never again! So check before you book, and if it's a newer 767, the plane should be ok (better pitch, personal entertainment unit, etc.) You can ckeck pitch and seat specs at seatguru.com.]
Unselected: DON'T FLY DELTA COACH UNLESS IT IS A NEW 767.
Selected: The bottom line on Delta Coach:Delta's other planes are configured with so little seat room, leg room, etc. (i.e., pitch) that they are like CROWDED CATTLE CARS. The airline should be ashamed to even put people on those planes, but clearly Delta does not care one iota about its passengers' comfort, even for long flights. I made the mistake on a recent HNL to LAX flight of flying Delta coach on a 757; never again! So check before you book, and if it's a newer 767, the plane should be ok (better pitch, personal entertainment unit, etc.) You can ckeck pitch and seat specs at seatguru.com.

MergedSelections: [I travelled to Australia using STA travel . Never again. I was taken ill and admitted to hospital and had to change my flights. STA travel informed my husband and I that we had to re-book our tickets immediately, that they would be held for 10 days, each ticket at a cost of £150 each; that after the 10 days if they had not been used then we would have to re-book for another 10 days at another £150 each and so on. Clearly I had no idea when I could travel back to the UK. Clearly this advice was absolute rubbish. The Airline and our travel insurance sorted it all out, no problem. The 10 day rule by STA and the £150 each ticket is clearly a money making exercise. I have been offered a paltry compensation, which I have not accepted. Customer services does not appear to be contactable by phone; they do not reply to letters. Now what do I do?]
Selected: I travelled to Australia using STA travel . Never again. I was taken ill and admitted to hospital and had to change my flights. STA travel informed my husband and I that we had to re-book our tickets immediately, that they would be held for 10 days, each ticket at a cost of £150 each; that after the 10 days if they had not been used then we would have to re-book for another 10 days at another £150 each and so on. MergedSelections: We just booked a trip with Sunwing to Mexico over the Christmas holidays and [although the property was nice, ]the flight there and back was a nightmare. [We signed up for trip alerts and didn't receive any but one that said they were ontime. Instead they were 4 hours late leaving Toronto and did not notify or communicate this to anyone until 15 minutes before when we were supposed to board. They made us wait for over an hour for a voucher for Lunch and then we got $5, which doesn't buy much more than a coffee at Pearson International. We paid for Premium seats because we had heard the seats were tight and then ours seats were double booked. We were worried about lost bags and went with carry on. When we arrived there were people that had lost luggage, I felt especiaily sad for this young teenage girl who was in tears on the bus ride to the resort. Coming home was no better. Web check in wasn't even offered on the way back Delays again coming home and the sign at the gate continued to read on time, even though they were not. They forced us to check our bags or pay several hundred dollars to carry them on even though we had less then when we went down and the bags were standard carry size for any other airline. We arrived so late that we had to pay for a hotel stay at the airport when we got back. On the 7.5 hour flight down we had one drink service that happened 3.5 hours after we boarded. First and last time flying with Sunwing. You couldn't pay me to fly with them ever again.]

We paid for Premium seats because we had heard the seats were tight and then ours seats were double booked. We were worried about lost bags and went with carry on. They forced us to check our bags or pay several hundred dollars to carry them on even though we had less then when we went down and the bags were standard carry size for any other airline. MergedSelections: [My wife and I flew Delta from JFK to Rome, Italy early June 2010. It was a nightmare. The plane had mechanical problems forcing us to divert to Halifax, Nova Scotia for nearly 10 hours! ]We lost a whole day in Rome b/c Delta has no clue how to properly service their planes.[ The flight crew was impolite and unhelpful, not to mention misleading in keeping passengers up to date on when we'd be back on schedule to our destination. Since we came home and shared this experience with friends and family we've heard that our story is nothing new. Delta has a well established reputation for messing up travel plans of passengers. So my advice to you is avoid Delta Air Lines. - Reuben]
Unselected: We lost a whole day in Rome b/c Delta has no clue how to properly service their planes.
Selected: My wife and I flew Delta from JFK to Rome, Italy early June 2010. It was a nightmare. The plane had mechanical problems forcing us to divert to Halifax, Nova Scotia for nearly 10 hours!  The flight crew was impolite and unhelpful, not to mention misleading in keeping passengers up to date on when we'd be back on schedule to our destination. Since we came home and shared this experience with friends and family we've heard that our story is nothing new. Delta has a well established reputation for messing up travel plans of passengers. So my advice to you is avoid Delta Air Lines. - Reuben

MergedSelections: Having read a lot of negativeTA comments re Ryanair in the past, I just wanted to express a positive comment re our first experience flying with them. [The price was excellent, my husband and I flew from Birmingham to Dublin return at a total cost of £40. We followed their terms and conditions re luggage size etc and online check-in without any problems. They emailed us reminders of both online check in and luggage sizes more than once prior to our departure flight. The flights were on time and we were very pleased with how everything had gone. We will most certainly use them again as we were very impressed. Huge thanks to them for ensuring our 30th wedding anniversary trip went well flights wise. I appreciate that other travellers sometimes have had genuine issues, I just felt it would be good and fair to say when something goes well.]

MergedSelections: Volaris charged me over $700 for my infant daughter to fly with them, despite the fact that it's against Mexican federal law to charge for an infant.[ I had purchased tickets for my wife, daughter, and myself online with no problems. Upon arrival at Zacatecas (ZCL) for our flight to Chicago Midway (MDW), they said "the system" wouldn't let them check her in because she's two years old (despite the obvious fact to the contrary according to her Mexican *and* US passports). They couldn't get "el sistema" to let them issue a boarding pass because we were within the month that she turned two (she was 1 year, 11 months). They gave us the ultimatum: buy a full price ticket or don't fly. Not wanting to miss Thanksgiving dinner, we caved. But, as they were trying to buy the ticket for her as an adult "el sistema" wouldn't let them because she was not yet two years old!!! They eventually lied, entered an older age, and gave us the Customer Service number and email address for a refund. Essentially the *same* thing happened on the return flight... except this time they said they had absolutely no record of her ticket and forced us to buy another one. Naturally, customer service at Volaris is a joke in English or Spanish. In Spanish, they'll talk down to you, tell you it was your fault, and stonewall you. They'll refuse to let you speak to a supervisor. In English, they'll sound very nice and helpful and then do nothing, saying they'll call you back after checking with the airport for more details. Surprise, surprise, they never call back. If you then call them back, the supervisor (if you're lucky enough to get one... usually the reps just refuse to connect you) will not take your call, leaving you on hold for hours. If you hang up and work your way through Customer Service to the same supervisor... he'll tell his reps to tell you "he'll call you right back." Two months later, and many, many hours on the phone, still no refund. Next stop PROFECO? ]Anyone else have this problem? What's the next move[ (besides obviously never flying with them again and advising everyone I know to do the same)]?
Unselected: Volaris charged me over $700 for my infant daughter to fly with them, despite the fact that it's against Mexican federal law to charge for an infant.Anyone else have this problem? What's the next move?
Selected: I had purchased tickets for my wife, daughter, and myself online with no problems. Upon arrival at Zacatecas (ZCL) for our flight to Chicago Midway (MDW), they said "the system" wouldn't let them check her in because she's two years old (despite the obvious fact to the contrary according to her Mexican *and* US passports). They couldn't get "el sistema" to let them issue a boarding pass because we were within the month that she turned two (she was 1 year, 11 months). They gave us the ultimatum: buy a full price ticket or don't fly. Not wanting to miss Thanksgiving dinner, we caved. But, as they were trying to buy the ticket for her as an adult "el sistema" wouldn't let them because she was not yet two years old!!! They eventually lied, entered an older age, and gave us the Customer Service number and email address for a refund. Essentially the *same* thing happened on the return flight... except this time they said they had absolutely no record of her ticket and forced us to buy another one. Naturally, customer service at Volaris is a joke in English or Spanish. In Spanish, they'll talk down to you, tell you it was your fault, and stonewall you. They'll refuse to let you speak to a supervisor. In English, they'll sound very nice and helpful and then do nothing, saying they'll call you back after checking with the airport for more details. Surprise, surprise, they never call back. If you then call them back, the supervisor (if you're lucky enough to get one... usually the reps just refuse to connect you) will not take your call, leaving you on hold for hours. If you hang up and work your way through Customer Service to the same supervisor... he'll tell his reps to tell you "he'll call you right back." Two months later, and many, many hours on the phone, still no refund. Next stop PROFECO?  (besides obviously never flying with them again and advising everyone I know to do the same)

MergedSelections: [United decided to not go along with its plan to end complimentary hot meals in economy on some international flights. ]Hot meals will be included on all Trans-Atlantic and Pacifc international flights again from all UA airports in all classes. [Here is the email: Dear Mr.(snip), Thank you for your direct, candid feedback on the test we had planned to launch in the fourth quarter for food choices on some of our flights. We heard you and have decided not to move forward with the test of offering customers buy-on-board options in United Economy on certain trans-Atlantic flights. We will continue to offer complimentary hot meals on those flights. The response from you and many of our corporate customers, even before we launched the test, told us what we would have undoubtedly learned had we proceeded - you value our hot meal service in economy class for international flights. In this environment, where higher costs driven by volatile fuel prices are now the norm, we must continue to tailor products and services so that we provide you with choices and competitive fares. As such, we will continue to be proactive in testing new ideas. On October 1, we will proceed with the test of new, complimentary options for United Business customers on three-cabin aircraft used for domestic routes, which represents 16 daily flights. Customers on these flights will receive complimentary fresh sandwiches, salads, breakfast, snack boxes or snacks, depending on the length of flight and time of departure. They will also continue to enjoy complimentary beverages, including beer, wine and cocktails. We will evaluate the results and determine next steps by the end of the year. It's also important to note that full meals will still be served on our p.s. transcontinental flights. Thank you again for your feedback. We will continue to listen and make changes that enable us in this environment to provide you with the choices you value. Sincerely, Graham Atkinson Chief Customer Officer]

Customers on these flights will receive complimentary fresh sandwiches, salads, breakfast, snack boxes or snacks, depending on the length of flight and time of departure. MergedSelections: Just saw this from FlyerTalk and the SFO website - "San Francisco International Airport (SFO) will conduct a series of temporary runway closures during 2013 to accomplish construction activity for federally-mandated Runway Safety Areas. [These closures will primarily consist of weekend closures of either Runway 28L or 28R, which are the primary runways for arriving flights. Only one runway will be closed at any given time. During closures, the arrival rate at SFO will be reduced from 60 aircraft per hour to 30 aircraft per hour. Delays for flights originating within a two-hour radius of SFO are expected to occur during peak travel times. Peak times are between 9:00 a.m. to12:00 p.m., and 6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. Travelers are strongly encouraged to contact their respective carriers regarding any potential delays." flysfo.com/web/…updates The dates listed are ... Jan. 11-14, Jan. 18-21, Jan. 25-28, April 5-8, April 12-15, April 19-22, April 26-29 , June 25-26 and and June 27-28 . Runways 28-L and 28-R are used for long haul takeoffs and for virtually all landings. The important point to note is that flights to SFO originating at an airport within a 2 hour flying time, will be subject to delays. These airports cover most of the west coast, from San Diego (SAN) in the south to Portland (PDX - my home) in the north. Seattle is a 2hr15 flight from SFO, so may not be immune. These delays already happen when bad weather hits SFO, as flights from nearby airports are subject to flow control. Should bad weather and these closures hit on the same day(s) it could be big time problems. If you have a flight to SFO and an onward connection for these dates, as referenced above you'd be advised to contact your airline. If you're planning on connecting via SFO from a nearby airport on these dates, allow an enormous amount of contingency, and even consider avoiding SFO altogether.]
Unselected: Just saw this from FlyerTalk and the SFO website - "San Francisco International Airport (SFO) will conduct a series of temporary runway closures during 2013 to accomplish construction activity for federally-mandated Runway Safety Areas.
